title: Object attached to string by disk

content.question: A solid disk of diameter <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></math> spins counterclockwise about its center at a constant speed. One end of a string of length <math alttext="l" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>l</mi></mrow></math> is attached to the edge of the disk with the other end attached to an object of mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></math>. At time <math alttext="t sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, as the disk spins, the string makes an angle <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></math> with respect to the vertical, as shown in Figure 1. A force diagram of all of the forces exerted on the object at time <math alttext="t sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> are shown in Figure 2.
